docs.snippet: Bridgewater, in his third year in the league, was expected to take some major steps forward this season....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bridgewater, in his third year in the league, was expected to take some major steps forward this season.
docs.abstract: Minnesota Vikings quarterback Teddy Bridgewater will likely miss entire season due to major knee injuries sustained in practice.

headline.main: Vikings Lose Quarterback Teddy Bridgewater for the Season
headline.print_headline: Vikings Quarterback Lost for Year With Knee Injury

docs.snippet: The proposals include prohibiting antidoping employees from having an overlapping leadership role in international sports and increased funding for the World Anti-Doping Agency....
docs.lead_paragraph: The proposals include prohibiting antidoping employees from having an overlapping leadership role in international sports and increased funding for the World Anti-Doping Agency.
docs.abstract: Antidoping officials from 17 countries meeting Copenhagen announce series of proposals for reforming global sports, including ban on antidoping agency employees from leadership roles in international sports.

headline.main: Antidoping Authorities From 17 Nations Push for a Series of Reforms
headline.print_headline: Antidoping Authorities From 17 Nations Push for a Series of Reforms

docs.snippet: While high-level sports are a type of entertainment, few other forms of mass-consumed entertainment have the anthem ingrained into every performance....
docs.lead_paragraph: While high-level sports are a type of entertainment, few other forms of mass-consumed entertainment have the anthem ingrained into every performance.
docs.abstract: San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick's refusal to stand during pregame national anthem prompts questions about why anthem is played at American sporting events and why country links sports and patriotism; Kaepernick says protest was motivated by police brutality and racial injustice in Untied States.

headline.main: Colin Kaepernick’s Anthem Protest Underlines Union of Sports and Patriotism
headline.print_headline: How the Game Became One With the Rocket’s Red Glare

docs.snippet: Bouchard contends that the U.S. Open’s organizers are liable because her injury resulted from a slippery floor in a room that was left open and unattended....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bouchard contends that the U.S. Open’s organizers are liable because her injury resulted from a slippery floor in a room that was left open and unattended.
docs.abstract: Canadian tennis player Eugenie Bouchard, who is still pursuing lawsuit against United States Open and United States Tennis Association after sustaining concussion at last year's event, loses to Katerina Siniakova in first round of 2016 US Open.

headline.main: Eugenie Bouchard Is Out, but Her Lawsuit From the 2015 Open Carries On
headline.print_headline: Bouchard Is Out, but Her Concussion Suit From the 2015 Open Goes On

docs.snippet: India's Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd said on Wednesday it has agreed to sell its sports broadcasting business to Sony Pictures Networks for $385 million, as it rejigs its media content delivery businesses....
docs.lead_paragraph: India's Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd said on Wednesday it has agreed to sell its sports broadcasting business to Sony Pictures Networks for $385 million, as it rejigs its media content delivery businesses.
